intro: Adenocarpus hispanicus var. anagyrophyllus, commonly known as the Spanish thornveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. This variant is distinguished by its pale green leaves and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
